answers.answer: what exactly is it reguarding? Something abnormal in a ultrasound? I have a high risk doctor because I am diabetic since before pregnancy. And my sugars are monitored weeekly.
Yeah something abnormal seen in ultrasound . I should of been more specific
I wouldn't panic. Sometimes a second pair of eyes helps. High risk doctors sometimes have better knowledge. Your doctor just wants best for baby. Hope it goes okay!!
Thank you shannir. I will keep that in mind
Mines does ultrasounds more frequent & detailed than my regular Dr to monitor baby
Any Blood work? Its my first time so idk what to expect

I was sent to high risk because of miscarriage i had 3 they do alot of blood work and ultrasound if they was something wrong that could be harmful to your baby it would show in blood work to good luck keep us posted don't worry too much i know it harder to do then said:)

I'm obese and pregnant so I was refereed to a fetal care specialist. She talked to me about diet and made referrals to cardiologists. She checked my blood results and urine results to rule out diabetes and high blood pressure.  I see her again for anatomy scan in mid October
Well all you have to do is take care of your  self good luck

question: So when you're referred to a high risk doctor for a second opinion what do they usually do?
title: high risk doctor
